body.p: Plugin command to clean up a storage plugin after restore.

section.title: Description
section.p: gprestore invokes the cleanup_plugin_for_restore plugin command on the master and all segment hosts when a gprestore operation completes, both in success and failure cases.

The cleanup_plugin_for_restore implementation should perform the actions necessary to clean up the remote storage system after a restore. Clean up activities may include removing remote directories or temporary files created during the restore, disconnecting from the backup service, etc.

plentry.pd: The absolute path to the plugin configuration YAML file.
The local directory on the Greenplum Database host (master and segments) from which gprestore reads backup files.

The execution scope (host or segment instance) for the plugin. Specify one of these values to execute the plugin based on the Greenplun Database configuration when the back up started.
master - Execute the plugin once on the master host.
segment_host - Execute the plugin once on the segment hosts.
segment - Execute the plugin on the segment hosts, once for each active segment instance.
For example, you run the command twice, specifying the scope master and then segment_host to run the plugin once on all the Greenplum Database hosts.

section.title: Exit Code
section.p: The cleanup_plugin_for_restore command must exit with a value of 0 on success, non-zero if an error occurs. In the case of a non-zero exit code, gprestore displays the contents of stderr to the user.
